Articles.Content:
Made a rover an orange fuel tank with a bunch of doughnut wheels (they look like doughnuts don't act like you don't know which ones.)

Used four largest lander legs to lift it off the ground.

Couldn't retract them.

A few different position let me retract them but in some positions not.

When not, only a lock suspension option is available on right click.

Edited June 25, 2015 by Daveroski

Do you have a save file with the craft in such a position (preferably a stock-only craft)? Does the output_log.txt/player.log show any errors or any other messages that look related when you try to retract them? If confirmed this should get added to the tracker (assuming it isn't already there). If the game lets you extend the legs but then doesn't let you retract them again then that could be a mission killing failure...

Do you have a save file with the craft in such a position (preferably a stock-only craft)? Does the output_log.txt/player.log show any errors or any other messages that look related when you try to retract them? If confirmed this should get added to the tracker (assuming it isn't already there). If the game lets you extend the legs but then doesn't let you retract them again then that could be a mission killing failure...

I'm still testing.

I think it may be a mass problem. I think my craft may be just a little too heavy. I'll mark this as answered until I know for sure.
